answers.author: Cori Burbach
answers.text:
Hi Wayne,
Dubuque is currently participating in the STAR Community program, which we've found extremely beneficial in both benchmarking against other communities and setting targets for ourself for future actions.  We are closely watching the ISO certification with potential interest in pursuing in the future if this shows to be a good international yardstick.  Good luck!

answers.author: Donald Gloo
answers.text:
Hi Wayne,
I've been casually following the reporting on the new ISO 37120, and I have a couple initial thoughts.  First, their list of things that cities should measure is heavy on the descriptors and outputs, but light on the outcome measures. Maybe as the standard evolves, the mix of measures will change--I hope so. I imagine just getting to this point was difficult for them.
Second, if I'm understanding correctly, the "standard" to be met is merely the reporting of a city's performance on the indicators. If you report your performance data, you've met the standard. ISO is making no judgement on a city's actual performance. That is probably by necessity because setting standards for actual performance on the indicators could be a real challenge, especially with a global mix of developed and developing cities.
Thanks for posting the question.
dg

answers.author: Gerald Young
answers.text:
Wayne,
We're looking at ISO as well, particularly where there's overlap or possible consistency to be achieved with ICMA's measurements, but will continue to focus on development and implementation of the ICMA Insights program to facilitate jurisdictions tracking and comparing their performance and charting their progress against goals.

author: Wayne Sommer
text: I was wondering if anyone is paying attention to this new ISO standard.  From what I have read, it is being touted as a "common performance yardstick".  I am skeptical and was wondering if any jurisdictions are giving this ISO standard serious consideration in their performance management efforts. And if so, how and to what degree.
title: ISO 37120 Sustainable development of communities -- Indicators for city services and quality of life
